main event: On July 17, 1966, two stationary objects with red and blue lights were observed in the southwestern sky near Belleville, Illinois.
interesting points: The observation lasted for approximately 20 minutes during which the objects did not move,The objects were estimated to be 24 inches wide and located about one mile apart,The lights shone bright and then dimmed at various intervals,The sighting was categorized as Astro phenomena (related to stars Spica and Denebola) after investigation,The report was submitted by a civilian witness.
sighted object: two stationary objects in the sky
